verses.kjv: When the LORD thy God hath cut off the nations, whose land the LORD thy God giveth thee, and thou succeedest them, and dwellest in their cities, and in their houses;
verses.web: When LORD your God cuts off the nations whose land LORD your God gives you, and you succeed them and dwell in their cities and in their houses,
verses.ct: When the LORD your God destroys the nations whose land he is giving you, and you take over their territory and settle in their cities and houses,

verses.kjv: Thou shalt separate three cities for thee in the midst of thy land, which the LORD thy God giveth thee to possess it.
verses.web: you shall set apart three cities for yourselves in the middle of your land, which LORD your God gives you to possess.
verses.ct: you must set apart 3 cities in the middle of the land the LORD your God is giving you to possess.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt prepare thee a way, and divide the coasts of thy land, which the LORD thy God giveth thee to inherit, into three parts, that every slayer may flee thither.
verses.web: You shall prepare the way, and divide the borders of your land which LORD your God causes you to inherit into three parts, that every man slayer may flee there.
verses.ct: Build roads to these cities and divide the land the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance into 3 regions, so that anyone who accidentally kills someone can flee to one of them.

verses.kjv: And this is the case of the slayer, which shall flee thither, that he may live: Whoso killeth his neighbour ignorantly, whom he hated not in time past;
verses.web: This is the case of the man slayer who shall flee there and live: Whoever kills his neighbor unintentionally, and didn’t hate him in time past—
verses.ct: Here is the kind of situation where someone may flee to one of these cities and be allowed to live: a person who kills his neighbor by accident, with no prior hatred between them.

verses.kjv: As when a man goeth into the wood with his neighbour to hew wood, and his hand fetcheth a stroke with the axe to cut down the tree, and the head slippeth from the helve, and lighteth upon his neighbour, that he die; he shall flee unto one of those cities, and live:
verses.web: as when a man goes into the forest with his neighbor to chop wood and his hand swings the ax to cut down the tree, and the head slips from the handle and hits his neighbor so that he dies—he shall flee to one of these cities and live.
verses.ct: For example, suppose two men go into the forest to chop wood. One of them swings his ax to cut down a tree, but the iron head flies off the handle and strikes the other man, killing him. The one who swung the ax may flee to one of these cities and be spared.

verses.kjv: Lest the avenger of the blood pursue the slayer, while his heart is hot, and overtake him, because the way is long, and slay him; whereas he was not worthy of death, inasmuch as he hated him not in time past.
verses.web: Otherwise, the avenger of blood might pursue the man slayer while hot anger is in his heart and overtake him, because the way is long, and strike him mortally, even though he was not worthy of death, because he didn’t hate him in time past.
verses.ct: Without these cities, the dead man's avenger might chase the killer in a rage and catch up to him because the distance is too far. He might strike him down, even though the man doesn't deserve to die — since he never had any hatred toward the victim.

verses.kjv: Wherefore I command thee, saying, Thou shalt separate three cities for thee.
verses.web: Therefore I command you to set apart three cities for yourselves.
verses.ct: That is why I'm commanding you to set apart 3 cities.

verses.kjv: And if the LORD thy God enlarge thy coast, as he hath sworn unto thy fathers, and give thee all the land which he promised to give unto thy fathers;
verses.web: If LORD your God enlarges your border, as he has sworn to your fathers, and gives you all the land which he promised to give to your fathers;
verses.ct: And if the LORD your God expands your territory, just as he swore to your ancestors, and gives you all the land he promised them —

verses.kjv: If thou shalt keep all these commandments to do them, which I command thee this day, to love the LORD thy God, and to walk ever in his ways; then shalt thou add three cities more for thee, beside these three:
verses.web: and if you keep all this commandment to do it, which I command you today, to love LORD your God, and to walk ever in his ways, then you shall add three cities more for yourselves, in addition to these three.
verses.ct: which he will do if you carefully obey everything I'm commanding you today, loving the LORD your God and always walking in his ways — then you must add 3 more cities of refuge beyond the first 3.

verses.kjv: That innocent blood be not shed in thy land, which the LORD thy God giveth thee for an inheritance, and so blood be upon thee.
verses.web: This is so that innocent blood will not be shed in the middle of your land which LORD your God gives you for an inheritance, leaving blood guilt on you.
verses.ct: Do this so that innocent blood won't be shed in the land the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance. Otherwise, you will bear the guilt for that blood.

verses.kjv: But if any man hate his neighbour, and lie in wait for him, and rise up against him, and smite him mortally that he die, and fleeth into one of these cities:
verses.web: But if any man hates his neighbor, lies in wait for him, rises up against him, strikes him mortally so that he dies, and he flees into one of these cities;
verses.ct: But suppose a man hates his neighbor, ambushes him, attacks him, and strikes him dead — then flees to one of these cities of refuge.

verses.kjv: Then the elders of his city shall send and fetch him thence, and deliver him into the hand of the avenger of blood, that he may die.
verses.web: then the elders of his city shall send and bring him there, and deliver him into the hand of the avenger of blood, that he may die.
verses.ct: The elders of his hometown must send for him, bring him back from that city, and hand him over to the avenger of blood to be put to death.

verses.kjv: Thine eye shall not pity him, but thou shalt put away the guilt of innocent blood from Israel, that it may go well with thee.
verses.web: Your eye shall not pity him, but you shall purge the innocent blood from Israel that it may go well with you.
verses.ct: Don't feel sorry for him. You must purge the guilt of innocent blood from Israel so that things will go well for you.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not remove thy neighbour’s landmark, which they of old time have set in thine inheritance, which thou shalt inherit in the land that the LORD thy God giveth thee to possess it.
verses.web: You shall not remove your neighbor’s landmark, which they of old time have set, in your inheritance which you shall inherit, in the land that LORD your God gives you to possess.
verses.ct: Don't move your neighbor's boundary markers. Previous generations set them in place to mark the inheritance you'll receive in the land the LORD your God is giving you to possess.

verses.kjv: One witness shall not rise up against a man for any iniquity, or for any sin, in any sin that he sinneth: at the mouth of two witnesses, or at the mouth of three witnesses, shall the matter be established.
verses.web: One witness shall not rise up against a man for any iniquity, or for any sin that he sins. At the mouth of two witnesses, or at the mouth of three witnesses, shall a matter be established.
verses.ct: A single witness isn't enough to convict someone of any crime or sin, no matter what it is. A charge must be confirmed by the testimony of 2 or 3 witnesses.

verses.kjv: If a false witness rise up against any man to testify against him that which is wrong;
verses.web: If an unrighteous witness rises up against any man to testify against him of wrongdoing,
verses.ct: If a witness comes forward and falsely accuses someone of a crime,

verses.kjv: Then both the men, between whom the controversy is, shall stand before the LORD, before the priests and the judges, which shall be in those days;
verses.web: then both the men, between whom the controversy is, shall stand before LORD, before the priests and the judges who shall be in those days;
verses.ct: both the accuser and the accused must appear before the LORD — standing before the priests and judges serving at that time.

verses.kjv: And the judges shall make diligent inquisition: and, behold, if the witness be a false witness, and hath testified falsely against his brother;
verses.web: and the judges shall make diligent inquisition; and behold, if the witness is a false witness, and has testified falsely against his brother,
verses.ct: The judges must investigate the matter thoroughly. If they determine that the witness lied and gave false testimony against his fellow Israelite,

verses.kjv: Then shall ye do unto him, as he had thought to have done unto his brother: so shalt thou put the evil away from among you.
verses.web: then you shall do to him as he had thought to do to his brother. So you shall remove the evil from among you.
verses.ct: then you must do to the liar whatever he intended to have done to the accused. In this way, you will purge the evil from among you.

verses.kjv: And those which remain shall hear, and fear, and shall henceforth commit no more any such evil among you.
verses.web: Those who remain shall hear, and fear, and will never again commit any such evil among you.
verses.ct: Everyone else will hear about it and be afraid, and no one will ever dare to do something that evil among you again.

verses.kjv: And thine eye shall not pity; but life shall go for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.
verses.web: Your eyes shall not pity: life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.
verses.ct: Show no pity in such cases. The penalty must be life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.
